intro: Helixanthera hookeriana, commonly known as the Hooker's helixanthera, is a rare flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes orchids, and is characterized by its unique floral structure. The plant produces small, delicate flowers with a distinctive helix-like arrangement of petals and sepals. It thrives in cool, moist environments and requires specific soil conditions to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
